questions.text: What song is used to 'Rickroll' people?
questions.explanation: Rick Astley's 1987 hit became the ultimate bait-and-switch meme.

questions.text: Which cat became famous for looking perpetually grumpy?
questions.explanation: Tardar Sauce, known as Grumpy Cat, became an internet sensation in 2012.

questions.text: What was the first video ever uploaded to YouTube?
questions.explanation: Co-founder Jawed Karim uploaded 'Me at the zoo' on April 23, 2005.

questions.text: Which social media platform was limited to 6-second looping videos?
questions.explanation: Vine, launched in 2013 and shut down in 2017, popularized short-form video loops.

questions.text: Who was everyone's first friend on MySpace?
questions.explanation: Tom Anderson, co-founder of MySpace, was automatically added as the first friend.
LOL is one of the oldest and most common internet acronyms.

questions.text: Which dress color debate broke the internet in 2015?

options.B: Black and Blue vs. White and Gold

questions.explanation: The Dress was a viral photo that viewers disagreed on perceiving.
GIF is a bitmap image format that supports animations.

questions.text: Which viral video featured a baby biting his brother's finger?
questions.explanation: 'Charlie Bit My Finger' was at one point the most-viewed video on YouTube.

questions.text: What is the name of the frog meme associated with 'feels bad man'?
questions.explanation: Pepe the Frog originated from a comic by Matt Furie.

questions.text: Which platform is known for its 140 (now 280) character limit?
questions.explanation: Twitter (now X) is a microblogging platform.

options.B: Horror-related legends copied and pasted around the internet

questions.explanation: Slender Man is a famous example of a Creepypasta.

questions.text: Which browser was once dominant before Chrome and Firefox?
questions.explanation: Internet Explorer had a usage share of over 95% in the early 2000s.
Used to summarize a lengthy post.

questions.text: Who is the founder of Facebook?
questions.explanation: Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook from his Harvard dorm room in 2004.
